result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel J Ruhe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE will be eligible for expunction if successful with conditions of the case.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
DE will comply with all programming recommended by DOC agent
DE will have credit for five days served.

Case settlement

Defendant Samuel J Ruhe in court with attorney Erika Caroline Bahnson.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15TR153, 16TR154, 16TR155.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  16TR153, 16TR155 will be DRI.  DE will enter a plea of amended Ct 1 in 16CF10 and Ct 2.  DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Ct 1 will be amended to possession of THC.  
Withhold sentence one year probation, will comply with DOC programming, provide a DNA sample/surcharge, CC, credit for 5 days served, expunction if successful with all conditions of the case.  

16TR154- $811.50 fine, 6 month revocation, PP of $50.00 per month commencing 8/01/16.
Review hearing on June 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
